**16. Our business requires working capital. Any failure in arranging adequate working capital for our operations may adversely affect our business, results of operations, cash flows and financial condition.**

Our business requires significant amounts of working capital including for financing our raw material purchases and manufacturing our products before we receive payments from our customers. Further, our working capital requirements may increase if, contractual or sales terms do not include advance payments or if under such contractual arrangements, payment is stipulated at the time of delivery of the final product to our customer. Moreover, our working capital requirements may also increase in the event we undertake a larger number of orders due to the growth of our business. The table below sets forth details in relation to our working capital cycle days, inventory days, trade receivables days and trade payable days as at and for the years indicated:

(1) Working capital cycle days is calculated as Trade Receivables Days plus Inventory Days less Trade Payable Days.

(2) Inventory days are calculated as Average Inventory divided by Cost of Sales multiplied by 365. Average Inventory is computed as average of inventories at the beginning and at the end of the relevant fiscal. Cost of Sales is calculated as Total expenses plus finance cost, finance income and depreciation and amortisation expense.

(3) Trade receivables days are calculated as Average Trade receivables divided by Revenue from Operations multiplied by 365. Average Trade receivables is computed as average of Trade receivables at the beginning and at the end of the relevant fiscal.

(4) Trade payable days are calculated as Average Trade Payables divided by Material Costs multiplied by 365. Average Trade Payables is computed as average of Trade Payables at the beginning and at the end of the relevant fiscal. Material costs includes Cost of raw material and components consumed, purchase of traded goods, construction material and contract expenses, and (increase)/decrease in inventories of finished goods, work-in-progress and traded goods.

(5) Financial information as at March 31, 2023 is not comparable with the corresponding information as at March 31, 2024 and March 31, 2025. For further information, see "- Our financial information as at March 31, 2023 is not comparable with our financial information as at March 31, 2024 and March 31, 2025." on page 65.

The actual amount and timing of our future working capital requirements may differ from estimates as a result of several factors including unforeseen events beyond our control, delays or cost overruns, unanticipated expenses, regulatory changes, adverse economic conditions, technological changes and additional market developments. Further, our future success depends on our ability to continue to secure and successfully manage sufficient amounts of working capital. Our inability to obtain adequate amounts of working capital in a timely manner and on terms that are acceptable to us, may adversely affect our business, results of operations, financial condition and cash flows.
